Dielectric Module

The Dielectric module contains models of the dielectric constants for different materials. In addition to including several models for saline water, ice and soil models are also included.

foam.dielectric.h2o_liquid_KleinSwift(frequency, temperature, salinity)

Model from Klein and Swift 1977 for sea water dielectric constant. Valid for frequencies lower than 50 GHz.

Parameters

  • frequency – Frequency in MHz

  • temperature – Temperature in Kelvin

  • salinity – Salinity in psu

Returns

Liquid water dielectric constant

foam.dielectric.h2o_liquid_MeissnerWentz(frequency, temperature, salinity)

Model from Meissner and Wentz 2004 & 2012 for sea water dielectric constant

Parameters

  • frequency – Frequency in MHz

  • temperature – Temperature in Kelvin

  • salinity – Salinity in psu

Returns

Liquid water dielectric constant

foam.dielectric.h2o_liquid_Ellison(frequency, temperature, salinity)

Model from Ellison as discussed by Maetzler 2006 - Thermal Microwave Radiation: Applications for Remote Sensing and Ulaby and Long 2014 - Microwave Radar and Radiometric Remote Sensing books. Similar formulation to the Meissner and Wentz model. Valid for 0-30 C, salinity less than 40 parts per thousand, frequencies lower than 1 THz.

Parameters

  • frequency – Frequency in MHz

  • temperature – Temperature in Kelvin

  • salinity – Salinity in psu

Returns

Liquid water dielectric constant

foam.dielectric.h2o_liquid_Boutin(frequency, temperature, salinity)

Model for seawater dielectric constant from Boutin et al. 2020.

Parameters

  • frequency – Frequency in MHz

  • temperature – Temperature in Kelvin

  • salinity – Salinity in psu

Returns

Liquid water dielectric constant

foam.dielectric.h2o_liquid_Zhou(frequency, temperature, salinity)

Model for seawater dielectric constant from Zhou et al. 2021.

Parameters

  • frequency – Frequency in MHz

  • temperature – Temperature in Kelvin

  • salinity – Salinity in psu

Returns

Liquid water dielectric constant

foam.dielectric.foam_Stogryn(frequency, angle)

From the empirical polarized foam emissivity (not dielectric constant) model of Stogryn 1972

Parameters

  • frequency – Frequency in MHz

  • angle – Satellite look angle in degrees off nadir

Anguelova parameterization will be added in the future

foam.dielectric.h2o_ice_Maetzler(frequency, temperature, salinity)

Computes permittivity of impure ice from Maetzler 2006. The model was developed for salinity around 0.013 PSU, and extrapolation is based on linear assumption to salinity, so over-extrapolation isn’t recommended.

Parameters

  • frequency – Frequency in MHz

  • temperature – Temperature in Kelvin

  • salinity – Salinity in psu

Returns

Ice dielectric constant

Code and documentation modified from the Snow Microwave Radiative Transfer Model (SMRT) https://www.smrt-model.science/

foam.dielectric.soil_dobson(frequency, moisture, sand, clay, temperature=296, density=1.7)

Soil model from Dobson et al. 1985 as presented in Ulaby and Long 2014

Parameters

  • frequency – Frequency in MHz

  • moisture – Volumetric soil moisture in g/cm3

  • sand – Sand fraction of soil

  • clay – Clay fraction of soil

  • temperature – Soil temperature in K

  • density – Soil density in g/cm3

Returns

Soil dielectric constant

foam.dielectric.soil_peplinski(frequency, moisture, sand, clay, temperature=296, density=1.7)

Soil model from Dobson et al. 1985 with Peplinski 1995 conductivity term The modified conductivity term is specifically relevant for frequencies between 0.3 - 1.3 GHz

Parameters

  • frequency – Frequency in MHz

  • moisture – Volumetric soil moisture in g/cm3

  • sand – Sand fraction of soil

  • clay – Clay fraction of soil

  • temperature – Soil temperature in K

  • density – Soil density in g/cm3

Returns

Soil dielectric constant

foam.dielectric.soil_modified_dobson(frequency, moisture, sand, clay)

Soil model from Dobson et al. 1985 with modification from the Aquarius Algorithm Theoretical Basis Document. Performs better for wet soil

Parameters

  • frequency – Frequency in MHz

  • moisture – Volumetric soil moisture in g/cm3

  • sand – Sand fraction of soil

  • clay – Clay fraction of soil

Returns

Soil dielectric constant

foam.dielectric.soil_hallikainen(moisture, sand, clay)

L Band soil model from Hallikainen et al. 1985 as discussed in the Aquarius ATBD. Performs better for dry soil.

Parameters

  • moisture – Volumetric soil moisture in g/cm3

  • sand – Sand fraction of soil

  • clay – Clay fraction of soil

Returns

Soil dielectric constant

foam.dielectric.soil_wang(moisture)

L Band soil model from Le Vine and Kao 1997 and Wang 1980. Performs better for wet soil

Parameters

moisture – Volumetric soil moisture in g/cm3

Returns

Soil dielectric constant
